programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The bloodless murder of livestock has plagued farmlands worldwide for generations. This programme considers the possible involvement of extraterrestrial beings in the act.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts make surprising discoveries as they explore the ancient past for evidence of alien overseers.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi have to break some bad news to the staff of one of their stores, while Rene tries to dominate his rivals.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The latest round of auctions prompts a career-changing bid from Ivy, while Jarrod and Brandi's Long Beach store is mired in gossip.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les question Ashley's skills of diplomacy after observing her interact with several customers.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Ashley compete to sell the most goods, with the loser having to pay a forfeit. A musician with limited funds seeks a new bass to replace the one he has broken.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: The Spider-Man co-creator teams up with Daniel Browning Smith to find people with abilities that would not seem out of place in one of his comics.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The case of a man found murdered in his burnt-out apartment in 1988, and how it took two decades to find the killer - a surprising culprit with a particularly sadistic side.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams bargain for an old Ford Transit and an ageing tractor to strip to a shell and sell on as parts for the highest sum of cash possible. Narrated by John Challis (car dealer Boycie in Only Fools and Horses).

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les question Ashley's skills of diplomacy after observing her interact with several customers.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Ashley compete to sell the most goods, with the loser having to pay a forfeit. A musician with limited funds seeks a new bass to replace the one he has broken.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Alien Files Unsealed investigates recently-released documents regarding alien and UFO encounters, made accessible to the public in 2011 by the Freedom of Information Act..

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Alien Files Unsealed investigates recently-released documents regarding alien and UFO encounters, made accessible to the public in 2011 by the Freedom of Information Act..

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Experts join the trail of purported Nazi time travel device, Die Glocke, to try and find out if it really did exist and if it could it have been based on alien technology.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: UFO sightings throughout the world during the highly active period of the 1970s. The sightings spread across locations from Kansas to New Zealand.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos examines the notion that extraterrestrials could have left clues to the universe's mysteries. Experts investigate cryptic puzzles that might have been placed by ancient aliens.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Huntingdon Beach, Mary engages Rene in a challenge with more than money on the line. Meanwhile, Darrell teaches Brandon a tough lesson.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell puts a plan in motion to net himself a big win. Meanwhile, Ivy changes strategy and focuses on obtaining collectible items.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod has trouble letting go of the reins after he and Brandi agree to let Alex and Bozek handle the auctions.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: People who make a living from bidding for the contents of abandoned storage units. They have only a few minutes to examine the lockers before deciding whether to make the risky purchase, but they have previously found shrunken heads, work by Picasso and the world's most valuable comic collection.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: There's No Business Like Snow Business
programme.desc: The buyers visit Rimforrest, California where they are hit with a snow storm. Plus, Casey attempts to keep Rene focused and Ivy goes on a shopping spree.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave hits the action hard in a Mojave Desert auction, despite his dislike of the area, while Mary struggles through a locker hoping her profits don't go down the toilet.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head for San Diego in hopes of finding some south of the border treasure, and Rene and Casey step up to defend their home turf against Darrell.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene cannot control his excitement over a collector's unit, while Jarrod and Brandi look to hit quick and easy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions between Karen and Ashley explode on the sales floor, so Les puts them both in the doghouse. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les goes on a buying spree that leaves his staff wondering what is going on. Meanwhile, Karen needs Byron's help to handle a pair of unruly piano players.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A hustler tries to make Les an offer he cannot refuse, but the Golds fight back and turn the tables on the shady customer.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley plays a prank on Seth to teach him a lesson about locking his door - but Seth evens the score with a practical joke of his own. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When the Golds uncover a series of bogus pawns, their investigation leads to a trusted employee and a confession. Reality series about the running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les and Seth visit a customer with a garage full of vintage cars. Against his children's wishes, Les offers big money for one of the owner's golden oldies.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: With Les and Seth away at the Autorama car show - and Ashley in charge of the store - the employees go a little crazy. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Karen tries to make peace between Seth and Ashley, Bobby J takes a two-story tractor for a spin and a watch snob riles Seth.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers go to Murieta, California, where Jarrod and Brandi hope to turn their recent run of misfortune around.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell makes the most expensive bid of his career, and Ivy learns a lesson that radically changes his approach to locker buying.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: The Pin Wheel crew gets lucky and closes in on leaders FV-Tuna.com. However, with two weeks of the fishing season left it is not the only boat to strike gold.

programme.title: 50 Years of Star Trek
programme.desc: Cast, crew and fans share their perspectives as we take an insider's look at the highs and lows of Gene Roddenberry's groundbreaking vision of the future, 50 years on from its beginning..

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: UFO sightings throughout the world during the highly active period of the 1970s. The sightings spread across locations from Kansas to New Zealand.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets his celebrity contestants challenges involving snowglobes, rubber ducks and wooden spoons. Alex Horne helps coax the contestants.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Stand-up and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with broadcaster and journalist Grace Dent and comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig has a Christmas knees-up in the pub with Alan Davies, Cariad Lloyd, Josh Widdicombe and Noel Fielding. Pub-themed questions are the order of the day, with a sprinkling of festive cheer along the way.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: John Bishop, Chris Addison, Joanna Page and Patsy Palmer join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? - The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: A compilation of unseen material from this series of the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests to dupe their opponents with plausible lies, featuring contestants including Ronnie Corbett, Bernard Cribbins, Richard E Grant, Jack Dee, Martin Clunes, Julian Clary and Sanjeev Bhaskar.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis serve up their unique festive take in a Christmas special filled with seasonal material, out-takes, best bits and hitherto unseen moments.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Modern Wheels or Classic Steals
programme.desc: Rebecca Jackson and Elo help car buyers choose their next vehicles. In the first episode, Kerri has to decide between a Porsche and a Karmann Ghia.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the Brazil event, in which teams of amateur racers design and build their own gravity-powered soapbox vehicles and race them in an extreme downhill battle.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and the team battle through the jungle into the heart of Indonesian Borneo. Here, a remote mountain range guards caves, holding secrets that could rewrite the history of man.

programme.title: Top Gear: Top Fails
programme.desc: A look back at all that Top Gear has tried and failed to accomplish, including spectacular fails, mixing shorter, one-off catastrophes with more developed failures.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May head to Norway to find out how a selection of cars fare when taking part in Winter Olympic events. Their experiments include firing a rocket-powered Mini off a ski jump, tackling the biathlon with 4x4s, staging a game of motorised ice hockey and timing the Jaguar XK in a speed-skating race.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Presenters Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are challenged to build a bridge over the River Kwai in Thailand. In order to do that, however, they have to drive across Burma, a country that has been largely closed to Westerners for more than 40 years, and must make the trip in three lorries, each bought sight unseen from the internet on a limited budget. What follows is an epic journey of beautiful scenery, regular adversity, ongoing malfunction and the constant bickering of the three men.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May set out to boost the British economy by embarking on a trade mission to India. Equipped with three old British cars and a range of uniquely British products, they set off on an epic road trip across one of the world's most fascinating and challenging countries, devotedly promoting Britain - with distinctly mixed results.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond compete in a land race from Resolute, Canada, to the North Pole in their most ambitious challenge to date. Pitting horse power against dog power they travel 450 miles across mountainous land masses and jagged sea ice at temperatures as low as minus 65C.

programme.title: Top Gear: Top Fails
programme.desc: A look back at all that Top Gear has tried and failed to accomplish, including spectacular fails, mixing shorter, one-off catastrophes with longer, more developed failures.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Teams battle against the clock in an extreme downhill race at the beautiful landscaped gardens of Villa Borghese, Rome.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Celebrities undertake some of the most perilous journeys in the world. Driving up Madagascar's eastern coast at the tail end of the rainy season is enough to test the best of friendships, but comedy actor Angus Deayton and broadcaster Mariella Frostrup are game enough to take on the challenge, and good enough friends to poke fun at each other along the way. The route has numerous river crossings and the duo face a variety of broken bridges and flimsy ferries as the only way across, while the roads themselves are mired with thick mud. Progress becomes increasingly painful and they are finally forced to spend a night in the car.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: In an episode first broadcast in 2013, Mrs Brown's Boys star Brendan O'Carroll and stand-ups Jo Brand and Phill Jupitus join regular panellist Alan Davies for a festive edition of the comedy quiz. Host Stephen Fry asks them a range of unusual questions on the theme of Kris Kringle and other Christmas-related topics.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: John Bishop, Chris Addison, Joanna Page and Patsy Palmer join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? - The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: A compilation of unseen material from this series of the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests to dupe their opponents with plausible lies, featuring contestants including Ronnie Corbett, Bernard Cribbins, Richard E Grant, Jack Dee, Martin Clunes, Julian Clary and Sanjeev Bhaskar.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis serve up their unique festive take in a Christmas special filled with seasonal material, out-takes, best bits and hitherto unseen moments.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies returns to set tasks for Dave Gorman, Al Murray, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Paul Chowdhry involving vegetable propulsion, snowmen and Swedes.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway, manager Stephen Greig is trying to ensure that all goes to plan ahead of the opening of the new station at Caernarfon.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: The Royal Palace of Caserta near Naples, Italy, which was created by Luigi Vanvitelli and houses a silk factory that dates back to the 18th century and still functions to this day.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Kensington Palace in London, which began life as an early 17th-century Jacobean mansion before becoming a palace fit for the monarchy, and was the brainchild of Christopher Wren.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: Examining the key events of 1941, including the Battle of the Atlantic, the invasion of the USSR, and major battles fought in North Africa and Greece.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: The events that led to the USA joining the Allied forces, and how their arrival altered the course of the war over the following year.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Churchill's plan to attack Germany through Italy. Although considered the simplest military solution, the Allies were to face formidable opposition, while the Americans met the Wehrmacht for the first time. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The longest retreat in British military history, when Allied troops defending Burma in 1942 were confronted by Japanese forces well prepared for jungle warfare. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Luftwaffe's bombing raids on Britain's provincial cities, when Coventry and Plymouth were hardest hit, although Portsmouth, Glasgow, Sheffield and Bristol also suffered heavy casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Performances by punk and new wave acts on the music show in 1977, including the Stranglers and the Jam, plus the continuing power of disco exemplified by Donna Summer's I Feel Love, the reggae of Bob Marley and pub rock by acts such as Eddie and the Hot Rods. Insight into performing on the programme comes from musicians including John Otway, JJ Burnel of the Stranglers, Paul Cook of the Sex Pistols, members of Darts and the Adverts, as well as contributions from Nicky Wire, Alexis Petridis and Pete Paphides.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Documentary about the change of musical direction in 1978, when pop singles were slowly ousted by disco, punk and new wave artists. The programme features contributions by members of the Boomtown Rats, Squeeze, Boney M and Sham 69 - among others - and archive performances by the likes of Elvis Costello, the Undertones, Ian Dury and the Blockheads and the Jam.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe narrates the first of three special editions of the archive music show focusing on 1960s hits, beginning with tracks by artists including the Foundations, Julie Driscoll, Sandie Shaw and Procol Harum.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Another selection of performances from the archives, focusing on hits of the 1960s. Featured artists include Clodagh Rodgers, the Move, Tom Jones and the Bee Gees, plus more from Top of the Pops and other shows from the era. Narrated by Mark Radcliffe.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Another selection of performances from the archive, focusing on hits of the 1960s. The programme features Lulu, the Kinks, the Walker Brothers and Don Partridge.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Performances by punk and new wave acts on the music show in 1977, including the Stranglers and the Jam, plus the continuing power of disco exemplified by Donna Summer's I Feel Love, the reggae of Bob Marley and pub rock by acts such as Eddie and the Hot Rods. Insight into performing on the programme comes from musicians including John Otway, JJ Burnel of the Stranglers, Paul Cook of the Sex Pistols, members of Darts and the Adverts, as well as contributions from Nicky Wire, Alexis Petridis and Pete Paphides.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Documentary about the change of musical direction in 1978, when pop singles were slowly ousted by disco, punk and new wave artists. The programme features contributions by members of the Boomtown Rats, Squeeze, Boney M and Sham 69 - among others - and archive performances by the likes of Elvis Costello, the Undertones, Ian Dury and the Blockheads and the Jam.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe narrates the first of three special editions of the archive music show focusing on 1960s hits, beginning with tracks by artists including the Foundations, Julie Driscoll, Sandie Shaw and Procol Harum.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Another selection of performances from the archives, focusing on hits of the 1960s. Featured artists include Clodagh Rodgers, the Move, Tom Jones and the Bee Gees, plus more from Top of the Pops and other shows from the era. Narrated by Mark Radcliffe.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Another selection of performances from the archive, focusing on hits of the 1960s. The programme features Lulu, the Kinks, the Walker Brothers and Don Partridge.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at some of Switzerland's 300,000 subterranean bunkers, built across history. Plus, the extraordinary creation of a Liverpool entrepreneur that's shrouded in mystery, and a network of man-made tunnels used by adventurous subterranean thrill-seekers deep beneath Slovenia's landscape.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A little-known dark past explains the vast monolithic structures that dominate the small British island of Guernsey.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek dives into the lost Jowett marque, as a Bradford-built 1952 Javelin finds an unexpected home. Paul and Dave uncover a Ford Escort that's been untouched for 30 years.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Zak and Alex face a four-day mission to deliver a pair of classic steam locomotives for an Autumn Steam Gala at the Mid Hants Railway in Hampshire.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At South Devon, engineer Ray Lee is working to bring a loco back in to service. There is also a visit to the SS Kingswear paddle steamer In Dartmouth, the oldest vessel of its kind.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The accidental fatal shooting of a Polish teenager in an armed police operation sparks a series of murders, which links Turkish gangsters, a grieving family and a fractured firearms unit. As the inquest delivers a lawful killings verdict, IPCC investigator Vicky Sharpe calls on the Lyell team to investigate the connection between the events and review the police evidence, but Sharpe's relationship with the family of the teenager and her suspicion of the firearms division lead Nikki and Thomas to distrust her motives. Feature-length episode, starring Emilia Fox.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The York princesses are strategically married off to strengthen the Tudor cause, but further political challenges are on the horizon. When King Henry finds himself back on the battlefield to protect his reign, Lizzie learns that the threats they face may be closer to home. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh faces chaos at home and work, with a mutiny on the farm following a drunken evening and a deadly pregnancy crisis with Hayley.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: The opening of Hugh's new cardiac clinic is upset by life-changing news from his ex-wife, and Charlie's life is thrown into disarray when her father makes a visit.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon spreads her wings and takes full advantage of her sister's hospitality, but Tracey is having money worries. Ross Kemp guest stars, with Linda Robson and Pauline Quirke.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy Garvey is awarded his medal at Buckingham Palace, and an old flame returns into Major James McCudden's life. Starring Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The men take part in a training exercise in dealing with chemical weapons, and the arrival of a new soldier in the regiment brings trouble.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Connie has received a string of complaints about Will, and puts him under observation for the day. Her concerns seem to be confirmed when he accuses a seriously ill patient of faking her symptoms - only to see her collapse in the wards and her husband threaten legal action. Chrissie urges Tricia to ask Carlos out, the tension rises between Jess and Zubin and Owen is determined to prove how committed he is to Diane and the baby.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ramani fears Terry has taken the law into his own hands when both he and Malcolm Willard go missing, but it seems the aged paedophile has more to fear from Terry's brother Ben, who is also looking for revenge. Irene Radford issues dire threats after her son Wayne is found dead in his cell, apparently from an overdose, while Neil reprimands Andrea for breaking regulations - only to end up in a passionate embrace with her.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Things look grim for Adam as the day of his trial dawns, until Andrea and Neil manage to expose Jerome Taylor's dirty dealings, while investigations into the death of paedophile Malcolm Willard raise the alarming possibility that a serial sniper could be on the loose in Sun Hill. An angry exchange with Shirley adds to Yvonne's woes as she anxiously awaits the results of her HIV tests.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon is close to owning the Queen Vic - until a face returns from the past. Ian attends an auction to bid for the local pizza restaurant and Frank gets himself into a state.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The Albert Square men go off on a fishing trip and there are some surprise arrivals at the canal bank. Sharon is forced to make a decision about the Queen Vic.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A water shortage means that the maternity home is busier than ever and two old schoolmates are reunited, but Marion shuns Shirley's attempts at renewing their friendship until they are brought together later in an unexpected way. Elsewhere, Barbara makes a revolutionary suggestion to help Sister Mary Cynthia treat the bedsores of her patient Tommy Mills, whose wife Gert may be more in need of care than he is. Fred thinks about taking the next step in his relationship with Violet. Drama, guest starring Una Stubbs and David Ryall.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie and Sister Mary Cynthia team up to support a deaf mother-to-be, while another patient causes great concern when a case of morning sickness proves more serious than initially suspected. On the personal front, handyman Fred's daughter is less than delighted to hear about his forthcoming wedding. Will he be forced to choose between her and Violet?.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Poplar readies itself for Christmas 1960 with a festive bus trip to see the Regent Street lights, while a visit from a BBC film crew promises to make it a festive holiday to remember. However, it's a difficult time for grieving mother Iris, bringing back memories of her long-departed baby daughter. At Nonnatus, things are tense as Sister Monica Joan determines to bring the Christmas spirit early - despite Sister Evangelina's disgust. As the community prepares for a televised carol concert, it becomes apparent that Sister Monica Joan has gone missing. Jenny Agutter and Judy Parfitt star.

programme.title: An Inspector Calls
programme.desc: Adaptation of JB Priestley's stage play. In 1912, a detective (David Thewlis) arrives in a town where a young woman has committed suicide. Interrupting a wealthy family in the midst of a lavish party, he unravels the events that led to the woman's death - an investigation with devastating repercussions as secrets are exposed and each member of the family realises they have all unwittingly played a part. Also starring Miranda Richardson and Ken Stott.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: When Kembleford's new cricket captain is framed for murder, Father Brown must prove his innocence to give his team any chance of beating neighbouring village Hambleston. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Humphrey is delighted when his Aunt Mary, the woman who inspired his love of puzzle-solving, arrives for a visit. But when she becomes the only witness to a fellow tourist's death - seemingly thrown from his hotel balcony in the middle of the night- she finds herself slap bang in the middle of a murder investigation. Meanwhile, JP takes relationship advice from Humphrey after confessing his feelings for Rosey - leaving him more confused than ever. Wendy Craig, Keith Allen and Susie Amy guest star in the island whodunit.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The Lyell team investigates the murder of a family shot while picnicking by a river, and discover the female victim was in the middle of a bitter divorce. Local detective Malcolm Guillam is brought in to help and when the present-day murder reminds him of an unsolved case that haunts him, he sees an opportunity to redeem himself. However, DCI Sally Butcher is convinced that the woman's estranged husband is responsible for the murder and has no time for Guillam's trip down memory lane. Feature-length episode, guest starring Derek Griffiths.

programme.title: Inside The Rebellion
programme.desc: An exclusive report from Sky News Climate Change Correspondent Hannah Thomas-Peter on the UK's most controversial activists.

programme.title: Review of 2019
programme.desc: Anna Jones and her guests look back on some of the big news stories of 2019.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: New Lines
programme.desc: Another chance to see two special reports in our New Lines series. The first is about cocaine use in Britain and the other about a crisis in rural housing.

programme.title: A Week in Interviews
programme.desc: Highlights from some of the best Sky News interviews of 2019, including powerful human interest stories and interviews from the worlds of politics, sport and showbiz.

programme.title: World News
programme.desc: A comprehensive look at the biggest stories from around the globe.

programme.title: Victoria Falls: Climate Change
programme.desc: Alex Crawford reports from Zambia on the impact climate change is having on the world famous Victoria Falls.

programme.title: Hotspots: On the Frontline
programme.desc: Alex Crawford and Stuart Ramsay witness starvation, desperation and anger as they go undercover in Venezuela, where people are fleeing in their thousands.

programme.title: World News
programme.desc: A comprehensive look at the biggest stories from around the globe.

programme.title: New Lines
programme.desc: Another chance to see two special reports in our New Lines series. The first is about cocaine use in Britain and the other about a crisis in rural housing.

programme.title: NinjaGo: Masters of Spinjitzu Wu's Teas Shorts
programme.desc: Cole has been tasked by Master Wu to sweep the shop clean of dust. Only the problem is, the dust is alive and fighting back.

programme.title: The Bagel and Becky Show
programme.desc: Bagel loses his precious house key in a massive snow drift. Offbeat animated comedy following a mis-matched brother and sister as they stumble into outlandish situations.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood film. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo, a Christmas volunteer in a supermarket, thinks a burglar is entering overnight and decides to stop him..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo forgets to include Mr Cat in his letter to Santa! To make amends he follows Weasel, dressed as an elf, who leads him to the AeroFizz..

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Magoo mistakes Weasel for a tuna being pursued by a fisherman..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: It's cold, the boiler is broken, and Mr. Bean has to get warm, fast..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Summer rears its hot, cheeky head in Grimsby but Dave has found a way to keep the Spud flat nice and cool. Maybe too cool..

programme.title: Scooby-Doo! Haunted Holidays (2012)
programme.desc: The cowardly hound and his Mystery Machine companions find their winter holidays interrupted when a sinister living snowman begins to torment the owners of a local toy store. However, as Scooby and the gang investigate, they find themselves trapped within the shop's factory, with their frozen adversary lying in wait. Animated mystery adventure, with the voice of Matthew Lillard.

programme.title: Disney's A Christmas Carol (2009)
programme.desc: A foul-tempered Victorian miser who hates the festive season is visited on Christmas Eve by a series of ghosts. The spirits intend to make him mend his wicked ways by showing him visions of the past, the present and what the future will hold for him if he does not change for the better. Animated fantasy based on Charles Dickens' novel, featuring motion-captured performances by Jim Carrey and Gary Oldman.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: The programme explores what makes this time of the year so special in Britain's countryside. Ben Fogle climbs Helvellyn with a man who battles the elements in the Lake District every day, while Paul Heiney views the Peak District from a glider and Liz Bonnin witnesses thousands of swans begin their journey from the fens of Cambridgeshire to their winter home in Russia.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: At a Christmas family get-together, a cracker riddle states two people will die before midnight on Boxing Day, and just a few hours later family matriarch Lydia meets an untimely end - giving Barnaby the perfect reason to escape a boring Christmas with his in-laws. John Nettles and John Hopkins star, with guest appearances by Haydn Gwynne and Margery Mason.

programme.title: Coronation Street at Christmas
programme.desc: A look at the rich seam of Weatherfield's archive to showcase the stories that have entertained millions over the festive season for almost six decades - from weddings and babies to flings and fights, not forgetting those Christmas dinner-disasters and poignant goodbyes. Contributors including Barbara Knox, Chris Gascoyne, Jane Danson, William Roache, Sue Nicholls, Simon Gregson, Jack P Shepherd, Helen Flanagan, Thelma Barlow and Julie Goodyear share their memories of watching numerous, big Christmas storylines. Narrated by Sue Johnston.

programme.title: The Queen
programme.desc: Her Majesty's annual address to the nation and the people of the Commonwealth.

programme.title: Shrek the Halls
programme.desc: Festive animated short featuring the full whimsical cast of the hit film series. Shrek settles down for a quiet Christmas with Fiona and the babies, but Donkey and the ogre's other friends have their own ideas - and the party soon descends into chaos. Featuring the voices of Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy, Cameron Diaz and Antonio Banderas.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: One of the most enjoyable things for viewers of The Chase is watching Bradley Walsh collapse in a fit of giggles after pronouncing a question wrong, or when a rude-sounding name crops up - or taking a contestant to one side to give them a telling-off if they get too big for their boots. Here, the host presents a third selection of these and other such unscripted moments and out-takes from the teatime quiz show.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.sub-title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars Christmas Special
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts a special seasonal edition of the quiz, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine in the hope of winning 20,000 for charity. This time, the famous faces taking part are comedian Joe Pasquale, TV personality Rustie Lee, and actress Nina Wadia.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.sub-title: The Chase Celebrity Christmas Day Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents a festive episode in which celebrity contestants presenter Kate Thornton, reality star James Argent, comedian Lucy Porter and presenter Nik Speakman pit their wits against all five Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: While someone gets a Christmas morning doorstep surprise, Kim has malicious intent, and Graham's mood darkens.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gary's stunned to find the furniture shop door open, and the gun and its ammunition missing. A worse-for-wear Derek lurches into the Rovers looking for Windass, pulls out a gun and fires a shot. Shona's plan for David's treasure hunt is soon forgotten when she and the Platts find themselves in the middle of a shootout. And while Seb comes to a decision about his future with Emma, Michelle puts her affairs in order as she makes plans to leave Weatherfield.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts a special festive edition of the quiz. Sports presenter Clare Balding, actor Stephen Mangan and Coronation Street's Catherine Tyldesley each sit in the hot-seat, hoping to win 1million for their chosen charities, and as usual they will have four lifelines to help them along the way - Ask the Audience, 50:50, Phone a Friend and Ask the Host.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: Christmas Road Trip - Three Unwise Men
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay, Gino D'Acampo and Fred Sirieix reconvene after their European travels to rediscover the spirit of Christmas, heading to the unlikely festive destination of Morocco to see what the North African country has to offer in the way of culture, cuisine and adventure. The trio journey through the Agafay desert by camel, on through the mountains and end up deep in Marrakesh's marketplace and souks, with their trip culminating in a festive feast inspired by their travels, the people they have met and the experiences they have had.

programme.title: Four Christmases (2008)
programme.desc: A couple have always managed to avoid family festivities by travelling overseas. However, when their flight is cancelled, each of their divorced parents insists they spend yuletide with them - forcing the pair to get through a quartet of Christmas celebrations on the same day. Comedy, starring Vince Vaughn and Reese Witherspoon.

programme.title: Jamie Laing's Luxury Christmas: Top 20
programme.desc: This is how Chelsea does Christmas! Heat Radio DJ and reality TV star Jamie Laing hosts the swankiest Christmas ever, with seasonal songs from Sam Smith, Little Mix and Mariah Carey.

programme.desc: Join Magic Radio's Pips Taylor as she runs down all the reasons we love Christmas. From wrapping up warm, to unwrapping pressies - there's a track to match.

programme.title: All-Star Christmas Takeover
programme.desc: Grab a mince pie and get ready for those Christmas feels, as the likes of Zara Larsson, Aitch and Sigma hand pick all their festive favourites to get you in the mood.

programme.title: Merry Hits-mas

programme.title: Big Narstie's Big Christmas
programme.desc: Big Narstie gets us all festive for his Christmas extravaganza, in which he teaches us how to cook a turkey, wrap a present and how to have a big Narstie Christmas.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How tunnels are built and the secret of the lion dance. Plus, a device that removes rain water from sports fields, allowing play to resume faster.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tracks down a Jaguar Mark 2 - but is later left to reflect whether the purchase has been a wise one as mechanic Edd China reports a list of serious defects.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: The host, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Phill Jupitus and Kerry Godliman, oversees a clash between The Burrell Arms from West Sussex and The Manor House from Coventry.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Featuring people who demonstrate an unusual affection for their cars, and a vicious, endless battle between cars and bikes.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Cameras capture more road-based disasters, including hot rides going up in flames, freaky motorcycle wipeouts, and unsettling 'redneck' car hobbies that defy all logic.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Rain causes two race cars to collide, a blaze breaks out at a fireworks stand, a truck accident collapses a motorway and a raceboat disintegrates at 240mph.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A tornado tears through a town, an electrical short causes an explosion in a warehouse and a racing car crashes through a barrier, flips and bursts into flames.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: The team must deal with disgruntled truckers, equipment shortages and technical failures, and tensions between the workers jeopardise the whole operation.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs and the team intend to surprise a deputy sheriff when they take his 1965 Ford Thunderbird from right under his nose and give it the ultimate makeover.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Husband and wife Nick and Jo risk one last supply to a remote settlement as the wet season looms. Meanwhile, Craig and his son deliver hay to drought-hit stations.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Brother and sister team Robbie and Ashleigh hit house removal hell on a mud-bogged mission out of Brisbane. Elsewhere, Nick and Jo battle storms in remote Western Australia.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Trucking legend Steve and his dog Bella take a huge load cross-country from Alice Springs to Perth. Meanwhile, engine issues see Russell struggle to hit a delivery deadline.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Russell's 30-year-old truck feels the strain on a run from Alice Springs to central Queensland. Meanwhile, Sludge wrestles flooded roads to deliver fuel to farmers.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Yogi risks a showdown with the law as he heads into South Australia. Elsewhere, Steve is under pressure with a truck out of action, and a run to a place he has never been to.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Yogi prepares for a showdown with transport police in South Australia. Elsewhere, Nick and Jo take on one of their toughest jobs yet on one of Australia's worst roads.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: Legendary train driver Bernie Baker needs all the diesel-muscle he can muster when he takes five Streamliner locos on a 2,500km odyssey across the searing Outback. The work of rail staff operating routes through the Australian wilderness.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: Bernie's coal truck odyssey goes horribly wrong. Two veteran locomotives risk destruction in a race for glory, and a mega-train faces the steepest grades in Australia. Documentary shedding light on the work of railway staff responsible for transporting train passengers through the blistering heat of the vast Australian wilderness.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: Bernie struggles home in five streamliner locos pulling 90 old coal wagons. Plus, after 20 years renovating an abandoned diesel locomotive, James wants to finally drive it.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: Cracks appear in a multi-billion-dollar iron ore railroad. Plus, learner driver James must survive the punishing Cockatoo run and the ire of instructor Dave Boyd.

programme.title: Mighty Trains
programme.desc: Teddy Wilson jumps aboard Rocky Mountaineer for a luxurious rail journey into the heart of the Rocky Mountains, taking in some engineering marvels.

programme.title: Mighty Trains
programme.desc: The White Pass & Yukon Route Railroad, which was built in 1898 to take miners and supplies to the newly discovered Klondike gold fields. The Alaskan route climbed nearly 3,000 feet in elevation in just 20 miles.

programme.title: Highland Railway
programme.desc: A journey along Scotland's 84-mile stunning scenic railroad route from Fort William to Mallaig, with unbeatable views of Ben Nevis, Loch Morar and the iconic Glenfinnan viaduct.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard unearths a steel corpus of Christ on the cross, and spots a divine early 19th-century gothic pew. Later, he finds a set of 1950s industrial pendant lamps.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: When architectural salvage hunter Drew Pritchard and his sidekick Tee gain access to a recently closed department store, they face a potentially almighty shopping spree.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Master blacksmith Neville Morris works on a piece of railing that was once a Victorian club fender. Meanwhile, Martin restores a Second World War RAF hero's bomber jacket.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in creating radars. Plus, the production of pistachios.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how wrecker trucks are built, the production of Roquefort and the transportation of trees.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: My Deadly Face Tumour: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A man with a facial tumour needs one more operation, but may not be able to face the procedure after a near-death experience.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: In 2012, young entrepreneur Terry Porter was found dead by his neighbour. There was no forensic evidence or witnesses, but surveillance footage was relied on for answers.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When Louise Dickey is discovered brutally murdered in a bath of her own blood, police were stumped. However, nearby surveillance cameras may lead to the shocking truth.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Cases in which partners teamed up to commit murder, including execution-style killings by two taxi drivers in New Jersey. Plus, an insight into a new DNA identification technique.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Officers investigate the abduction of Christine Aragao and her two young children in Miami just days before Christmas, hoping to determine who has kidnapped them before it is too late.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: The team visits a house near Detroit that has become overrun by aggressive feral cats.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Terrier Benji is suffering from a heart murmur that could be fatal without immediate surgery. Dr Chris Brown entrusts the dog's operation to Dr Andrew Marchevsky.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride is racked with indecision, and a customer who wants to look like a 'classy porn star' is in for a surprise.

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy returns to help beleaguered owners tame their boisterous felines. He meets skydiver Jacques, who owns two ferocious Savannah cats, and Bijan and Heather, who are being driven apart by the territorial Wolfie.

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy helps a firefighter in Los Angeles who is struggling to deal with a crazy cat, while a Texan couple are disturbed by their kitty's night-time terrors.

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy this week comes to the aid of felines Littlez and Whiskey, whose troublesome temperaments need reining in.

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy investigates the behaviour of cat Einstein, which is mild until it sees fellow feline Izzy - and then goes on the attack. Plus, an expectant couple worry about their pet's mood swings.

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy examines and tries to tame aggressive cat Symone, which launches into an attack whenever it hears owner Kelly laughing or crying.

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy helps newly-married couple John and Samantha. The pair are having trouble taming the latter's cat, Puma, which seems resentful of John in particular.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Here Comes the Bride Again - and Again
programme.desc: Keasha bonds with cancer survivor Jennifer during the search for a dress, and a bad-tempered bride takes her frustrations out on Vera.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Two brides from Baltimore come to the bridal store for a joint appointment - but they have very different ideas, while new fashion director Randy is ready to make his mark.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: An interfering mother of the bride makes things difficult for Diane, while Keesha gets good news about the lump she found in her breast.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman who is renewing her wedding vows brings her two sons with her to choose her dress, but struggles when they do not approve of her choice.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Rochelle brings her family over from California to help her choose her dress, including her opinionated father, and a girl finds it difficult to stay within her budget.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Chaos hits the store with the launch of the annual sale, as queues form outside the building and the owner breaks his own strict rules.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The store's buyers head to Bridal Market Week, a crucial event where designers showcase their latest trends, while Sarah helps an Islamic bride.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kleinfeld's welcomes a variety of clients, from a bride with a liking for vintage fashion, to a biker chick with more outlandish tastes.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Gonna Sing You a Song 'Bout the Dress I Don't Have
programme.desc: Country singer Stephanie has only 13 days until her wedding - will she find the perfect dress or be left singing the blues?.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: If I Feel Like a Penny, I Need to Look Like a Million
programme.desc: A breast cancer survivor clashes with her mother over how she wants to dress for her big day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Say Yes to the Dress: The 12 Dresses of Christmas
programme.desc: Randy looks back at beautiful festive bridal looks, counting down his 12 favourite Christmas styles.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs helps a woman hoping to find and bond with her biological mother. Plus, how a near-death experience in combat triggered a young veterans' search for his birth family.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Devoted girlfriend and loving aunt Alicia is all smiles on the outside, though inside is terrified her addiction to food will kill her before she can marry.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: Born with Four Legs: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: Arun, from India, has four legs, with the second pair growing from his back. He travels to Delhi to seek an operation, but will doctors be able to help and will his family agree?.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: Featuring triplets undergoing a second round of life-saving surgeries, an Argentinian with unusually long limbs and an extraordinary story in Brazil.
